title: Windows 8.0 AIO x86 en-US WIM Baseline
description:
murphy78 presents Windows 8.0 AIO x86 en-US WIM Baseline

No Windows 8.0 Settings were harmed in the making of this ISO.
No Programs are added to Windows.
No Registry Settings were modified.
No Unattended Settings were added to the ISO.

32-bit MSDN Sources:
en_windows_8_enterprise_n_x86_dvd_918707.iso
en_windows_8_enterprise_x86_dvd_917587.iso
en_windows_8_n_x86_dvd_916097.iso
en_windows_8_pro_n_vl_x86_dvd_918877.iso
en_windows_8_pro_vl_x86_dvd_917830.iso
en_windows_8_x86_dvd_915417.iso

These RTM Sources are the final Build 9200

Installation Indexes:
Windows 8.0 (Core) x86
Windows 8.0 (Core) N x86
Windows 8.0 Pro x86
Windows 8.0 Pro N x86
Windows 8.0 Pro with Media Center x86
Windows 8.0 Pro VL x86
Windows 8.0 Pro N VL x86
Windows 8.0 Enterprise x86
Windows 8.0 Enterprise N x86

Release File: Win80AIO-x86-en-US-WIM-Baseline.iso
Size: 2.75GiB
SHA-1: 3B4BBAC220F3DCF2A54DE4E1140E260525B5378A

Language: en-US (English - United States)

Tools used:
Microsoft DaRT8 SP1 (thx anarchist9027)
imagex for renaming, prowmc index flag, export
dism for set-edition for ProWMC
oscdimg for ISO mastering

Features:
-Modifiable install.wim format.
-DaRT8 SP1 integrated into Boot.wim Choose the "Repair your computer" option.

Notes:
These are Un-modified Indexes with no extra files, settings or integration.
ProfessionalWMC index is not available typically and is created using
dism commands and imagex settings, but it is otherwise unmodified.

-This baseline WIM version will likely be the main release path for patches
I create each month. I had many people complain of 97% failure using install.esd
recovery compression on the final integrated versions of 8.0

-I recommend printing out the win80-pkeys.txt for installs. You can access
the one I put on the disk using shift-f10 during setup, navigating to the dvd
or USB Flash drive, and running "type win80-pkeys.txt" Then simply tab between
the command prompt and the key entry window.

Credits:
murphy78 - Testing, and ISO design

Enjoy Pirates,
murphy78-TPB/MDL :)
